reviews.text: I stayed at the Riverside Inn as part of a Trek America trip in July/August 2010. Stowe itself is a lovely place - unfortunately I didn't see much of it, but it looked really nice!
reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but it does the job well!

reviews.text: As for the Inn, I thought it was alright - our whole group took up the main building so I got a look around a few of the rooms, some of the decoration is a bit random between the rooms (it isn't like a chain hotel where every room looks the same!) - it was suitably well kept, shared bathrooms were in good condition and the bed was quite comfy I thought! We used the kitchen downstairs, it wasn't the newest kitchen I'd ever seen, but it did the job.
reviews.title: Affordable, wonderful location, but far from polished or elegant

reviews.text: There was a lounge downstairs, with a TV and some comfy sofas, and a pool/snooker table for guest use. The group I was with spent our evening playing pool and watching a movie - it was quite a cozy place to hang out!
reviews.title: Great value, great hosts

reviews.text: The owners were a lovely couple, I spied the Jaguar E-Type in the Driveway and had a wee chat with the chap about it, him and his Wife were always up for a bit of banter and joined us in the evening when we cooked our tea - very hospitable bunch.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs

reviews.text: I didn't spend long here, or in Stowe - but if you are after well-priced accomodation (and not much else, I'll admit - but free WiFi!) then you won't go far wrong staying here!
reviews.title: Great value for money and very friendly

reviews.text: A big group of us (nearly 50 in all) rented the entire place. I must say that rhe rooms were small and not all of them had their own bathroom. The furniture and kitchen appliances were old. But the Riverside Inn worked wonderfully well for our group. The adults could move about freely and not worry about spilling their beer. The kids could run around making noise. You could throw your gear on the lobby floor and not worry that you were doing something wrong. You could watch TV, play cards at the living room table, hang out in the kitchen or discuss the day's skiing on a couch in front of the fire.
reviews.title: Nice place for a group

reviews.text: The owners Julian and Kay were genial hosts ready to try to accommodate our requests.
reviews.title: Smelly & outdated

reviews.text: The drive to the Stowe ski resort took only 10 minutes up the Mountain Road. A shuttle passes every 20 minutes.
reviews.title: If you're trying to save

reviews.text: So while it isn't fancy, I would recommend the Riverside Inn for any group wanting a congenial place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely Home and Had a lovely time!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Better places than this! Soooo smelly, muddy outside & outdated furniture. Old duvets & carpets.Needs some dollars invested in it desperately! Go elsewhere. Pleasant owners though.
reviews.title: Average Pet-Friendly Motel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights on a very rainy weekend. The accommodations met our expectations. We stayed in the motel and the room was large (2 queens and a single) with a private bath. The other room we used was inside the Innn. It had an exterior entrance and was quite nice with twin beds and private bath. The innkeepers were very warm and welcoming. We had a dog with us and he was welcome anywhere. One evening we used the large table in the main house to eat pizza and play games. The innkeepers told us to make ourselves at home. They kept the woodstove burning for us and it was very nice.
reviews.title: Nice Surprise

reviews.text: This summer was the second time we stayed at this Inn. We have stayed there over for a winter vacation and would very like to come back.
reviews.title: The best innkeepers we ever have meet

reviews.text: This place has a great atmosphere and the best innkeepers we ever have meet! They really make our stay a succes.
reviews.title: loved it here

reviews.text: They don´t pretend to be a fancy place and for the money you pay for this place you really get a super deal! For us it is not about the money but the innkeepers! They are simple the best!!
reviews.title: A Car and Motorcycle fan's destination

reviews.text: Lis and familiy
reviews.title: Rec Room Rustic decor OK, but beware of their NO REFUND policy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: no luxury amenities here! but that's not why you book a room here... it's cheap, in a great location, and you have plenty of $$$ left over for several weeks worth of ski passes. the shed and piecasso are just a stone's throw away. a huge perk is that the back of the property is on the stowe recreation path. we snowshoed for several miles on the rec path. we booked a room at the main house. innkeepers were very welcoming. we had our own bathroom, but many rooms had to share a bathroom. don't expect tv or cable. really bare bones here, you get a bed and a roof over your head. wi-fi only worked downstairs in the communal living area, signal was too weak for us to connect upstairs in our room. floors are creaky, you can hear everything your neighbors are doing (but everyone's fairly respectful about noise level). probably would not book a room here again because we need more upscale amenities, but we can appreciate the tremendous value of this place.
reviews.title: priority is.... ski first, ski second and ski third. sleep is for the weak.

reviews.text: When we arrived at the Riverside, we were welcomed into the in with warm hands. Almost like when you arrive at a nice family members house. Never any problems, inn keepers are great on advice (where to eat, hang out, etc.). We had to cut our stay here early because they were all booked up so we stayed at the Stowe Mountain Lodge but superb Hospitality. We'll be back, no doubt about it! Thanks Kay and Julian (Inn Keepers)
reviews.title: Wow. Nice inn keepers, Great bang for your buck!

reviews.text: I stayed in the main house for a couple of days as part of a Trek America group tour. The place is clean, warm and has a real homely feel to it. It also has a big log fire which was going strong throughout my stay. In addition to that there is a pool table and free WI-FI.
reviews.title: a great little place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The host's are Julian and his wife Kay who made us feel very welcome and enjoyed chatting to the group. They also lent us ski gear if we needed it to save on rental costs.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stowe was one of my highlights of this trip[ and I fully intend to return and stay at the Riverside Inn.
reviews.title: Great value Great Hosts
